availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Long (Lyon County, Kentucky, dry goods merchant and post master)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, dry goods merchant and post master. Married to Julia A. Long. Father of Helen M. Long and John E. Long. Dry goods merchant in Lyon County in 1860. Postmaster of Eddyville from May 20, 1863 to June 18, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Ancestry.com. U.S., Appointments of U. S. Postmasters, 1832-1971 [database on-line]. Provo, UT, USA: Ancestry.com Operations, Inc., 2010. Original data: Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971. NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, 145 rolls. Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28. Washington, D.C.: National Archives, Eddyville, Lyon County, KY, Volume 28, 20 May 1863, p. 126.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 761.
